'''''Mythlore'' 113/114''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol29/iss3/ Volume 29, Issue 3/4]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].

==Contents==

====Articles====

* Croft, Janet Brennan. "A Bibliography of Glen GoodKnight's Articles, Reviews, and Major Editorials in ''Mythlore''."
* Bullard, Sadie H. "Narrative Dualism in C.S. Lewis's ''That Hideous Strength.''"
* Himes, Jonathan B. "A Matter of Time: C.S. Lewis's ''Dark Tower'' Manuscript and Composition Process."
* Grybauskas, Peter. "Dialogic War: From the ''Battle of Maldon'' to the War of the Ring."
* Milburn, Michael. "Art According to Romantic Theology: Charles Williams's Analysis of Dante Reapplied to J.R.R. Tolkien's 'Leaf by Niggle'."
* Christopher, Joe R. "The Dantean Structure of ''The Great Divorce''."
* Downey, Sarah. "Cordial Dislike: Reinventing the Celestial Ladies of ''Pearl'' and ''Purgatorio'' in Tolkien's Galadriel."
* Koubenec, Noah. "The Precious and the Pearl: The Influence of ''Pearl'' on the Nature of the One Ring."
* McGregor, Jamie. "Two Rings to Rule Them All: A Comparative Study of Tolkien and Wagner."
* Croft, Janet Brennan. "TÃºrin and Aragorn: Evading and Embracing Fate."

====Features==== 

*Croft, Janet Brennan. Editorial.
*Letters: Stalin's Orcs. Robert T. Tally Jr.

====Reviews====

* ''A Sword between the Sexes?: C.S. Lewis and the Gender Debates.'' Mary Stewart Van Leeuwen. Reviewed by Joe R. Christopher.
* ''The Cambridge Companion to C.S. Lewis.'' Edited by Robert MacSwain and Michael Ward. Reviewed by Gregory Bassham.
* ''The Law and Harry Potter.'' Jeffrey E. Thomas and Franklin G. Snyder, eds. Reviewed by Douglas C. Kane.
* ''Merlin: Knowledge and Power through the Ages.'' Stephen Knight. Reviewed by Harley J. Sims.
* ''Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings: Sources of Inspiration.'' Ed. by Stratford Caldecott and Thomas Honegger. Reviewed by Charles A. Huttar.
* ''One Earth, One People: The Mythopoeic Fantasy Series of Ursula K. Le Guin, Lloyd Alexander, Madeleine L'Engle and Orson Scott Card.'' By Marek Oziewicz. Reviewed by Donna R. White.
* ''War of the Fantasy Worlds: C.S. Lewis and J.R.R. Tolkien on Art and Imagination.'' Martha C. Sammons. Reviewed by David Bratman.
